intro: Cryptostegia madagascariensis var. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern Madagascar cryptostegia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its woody vines and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and yellow-orange floral corollas that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its geographic distribution and specific morphological traits compared to other varieties of Cryptostegia.
